title: Planning the Future of a Distribution System
items.abstract: <jats:p>In planning water improvements for the Baltimore metropolitan area, there is no fixed method of operation. The analog computers of today may become obsolete tomorrow. Predicted growth may be altered considerably in pattern and intensity. Present concepts of establishing goals may change. Political agencies that will have the authority to implement these goals will vary in outlook through the years. Nevertheless, it appears that planning always will require a blending of vision tempered with practicality and economy.</jats:p>
